article_node.title: Trump's administration may look to buy a stake in Intel
article_node.summary: Intel is reportedly in discussions with the US government about a potential acquisition of a stake in the company to enhance its manufacturing capabilities in the US. The chipmaker has announced significant workforce reductions, planning to cut its staff by over 20% by the end of 2025, while also delaying the opening of its Ohio chip fabrication facilities to 2030. New CEO Lip-Bu Tan is implementing cost-cutting measures and restructuring efforts to improve operational efficiency amid ongoing challenges in the semiconductor market.
